comment: I took this course over the summer along with another course. It was a lot of work, but I was able to earn an A. Prof. Thomas ensures you have everything you need to be successful; you need to be prepared to stay on top of things. There is a big semester project and presentation, but if you work on it ahead of time, you'll be fine.
Don't take this guy online if you value your grades and sanity for any non coding majors
He was super helpful and nice!! Looked forward to going to class. lots of homework tho.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Thomas is always there for help and heavily encourages asking questions. The workload itself is easy. The coding is easy to follow and won't take you much time but it does get harder after each lesson.   There are NO exams and the final project is easy! This class is an easy A as long as you are keeping up with the weekly assignments.

I love Prof. Thomas; I couldn't imagine taking anybody else. I will definitely take him again next semester for IS4880. You'll be doing a lot of coding practice per week, maybe 3-5 hours, but believe me, it's worth it. The only reason I'm so interested in coding now is due to the way this class was presented.

Professor Thomas was engaging in teaching style, communicated effectively, and had great support for student learning. He provided feedback regularly and was available for questions outside of class. He possesses strong subject matter mastery. I'll recommend this course with him.
Dr. Thomas is great. I enjoyed his class the most so far in the HMI program.

This professor is top notch. He knows what he is talking about and we got to do some cool things. BY FAR - the best professor in my program. The first portion of the class is fast paced and homework heavy. The second portion of the class allows all of the learnings to marinate a bit and then put into practice. You won't regret taking Dr Thomas.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Thomas is very insightful and easy to understand in class.  He allows free discussion on the presented topics and encourages student teamwork.  I have thoroughly enjoyed Dr. Thomas' class this semester and would love to take more classes with him and possibly be a colleague of his in the near future.
Process and task simplicity

Professor Thomas is one of the best Teachers I have had. The class itself is well structured and he knows what he's talking about. He really shines in the way he tries to help every student outside of class with their career. He is also very involved in the IS department and willing to help you succeed in getting an internship or Job

He is such a sweet professor and cares for all of his students. He also held meetings on teams with outside people to get people to learn about new jobs and meet with them. Wish I could take him as a professor for all my MSIS classes (This was Class IS 7700 Policy and strategy... wasn't an option at the top section)
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He actually cares about the students and will talk to you 1-on-1 after class just to help you with whatever.

The grading criteria could use some work. You're graded on a plethora of things that will get overwhelming. You have lots of homework to do every week (coding), but other than that, he's very lenient on late work and other things that make it worth the confusion. His lectures are pretty useless in terms of course content. Other than that hes cool
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: This is by far my favorite class and Professor in the curriculum.  He is very encouraging and understanding.  He cares about his students learning and he is fair.  If he offered 10 classes in the program I would take all 10.

Doctor Thomas has a fun teaching style. He knows how to engage the students. And he truly enjoys what he teaches. In my experience, the class was easy to understand. Programming as a beginner seems intimidating initially. Once you understand the basics, it becomes simple. This course drills you on the basics, and gives you enough to do alot more.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: You can learn so much when taking Dr. Thomas's class. He is very knowledge about the topics he teaches and provides ample amount of examples. He works with his students and really promotes an environment where students are encouraged to learn from each other.

Prepare to be taught by a professor who knows his subject in and out. He is passionate about it and will inspire you to be passionate about it too. Go in like a dry sponge and soak up all he has to offer you and trust me, that will be a lot. Listen to him and feel his energy and not only will you succeed in his class, you will succeed in your Life.
He really cares about the subject and it shows. He really works with students who dont understand and breaks things down so that they can. The lectures are fun.

This professor is THE most pretentious teacher on staff at KSU without question. If you take him, expect 3 teachers for one class, confusion, and a pitiful syllabus. Last week of class he tells us how attendance works, causing mass posting panic, and is rude to students who didn't already know, which is over half the class. Proud and self-righteous

Dr. Thomas cares about his students understanding python. He really encouraged us on ways to get great careers after graduating by setting up guest speakers throughout the semester. The work load might appear overwhelming at first but he does give extra time to have all the assignments done. Highly recommend him.
Dr. Thomas is not only an expert on the subject matter but is also a professionally trained teacher; that's a rarity nowadays. One of the best professors I've ever had.

Dr. Thomas is the first professor we've had in this program who genuinely cares whether we are learning or not. He is a true educator. He is passionate about what he teaches and about empowering each of us to succeed.

Professor Thomas is a natural mentor. His course helped me in career building and recognizing my strengths. He is always available to help and passionate about teaching students how technology works in the real world. He is inspirational and respected. He guides students on how to leverage their skills in the real world.

Dr. Thomas is very passionate about Python, and it shows in his teaching style. The course is interactive and incorporates fun activities within the curriculum. Most importantly, if you need further clarification about the content, he will make time for his students to review the material.

The way he plans his class and motivates the students to do the work, I like that so much. He always encouraged the students about the IT field. He always guides us that how much it is important for us to learn to code and have an idea about management.

Don't take if you have any other classes, the amount of coding due each week takes hours, grades are posted at random and he told half our class to change majors because we wouldn't be successful in the IS field and to "go make less money as an accountant." He laughs at all his rude remarks. I will never step foot into a class he teaches again.

Can be a heavy class over the summer probably better during a regular semester. Profs. sets the course to learn about python for the first half of the course with the other working on a project of your choice which was the best part. Uses teams for talking to him and other students, the response time varied but just don't overthink it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Responds to emails by telling you to post in Teams. Then ignores your post on Teams. Graded half the assignments the day final grades were due. Responded to posts about assignments after the due dates. 5% of the grade is arbitrarily attributed to your "participation & attendance." Will hold random meetings & announce them only 10 minutes prior.

Puts grades in twice in the semester, once midway through and once one the very last day that he's allowed to. 0 way to know your grade any other time. He's MIA 95% of the time if you're online. Start your homework early, you have 5+ hours of coding to do each week, sometimes more than once a week. Do not expect a grade bump even if you're .05 off

Please do not take this class over the summer. Work due every other day. "Attendance matters" Even though it was an online class over the summer with no meeting times? It's based on how many times you log into d2l and Teams. He only grades after midterms and then finals so you wont know where you stand until the week after finals. LOTS OF WORK.

Great professor and someone who truely cares about his students. He is always willing to help out, and makes class really entertaing. the class its self isn't that hard along as you do the work, and if you are having trouble he is more than willing to help you with the material.

If youre online, you can attend the lectures, but the course work is set up really well and you will learn a lot doing the supersimple proof-of-concept assignments sprinkled in between the actually coding assignments. It is structured like a smart book in an interactive code environment with no fluff, which I thought was great. Learned some things!

Professor Thomas is one of my favorite professors at KSU. He takes the time out of his day to help you out if you need it. His class is clearly structured and the assignments are straight forward. He made learning Python a breeze, and for those who haven't coded before, he works with you to help you understand it.

Dr. Thomas inspires his students to tackle difficult problems in the course's project. Also, I would say, the grading system is both forgiving and clear from the beginning of the semester. He also offers to help with your resume. Even though this was a hybrid class, he streamed the lectures through teams for online students.

Dr Thomas is a really solid choice for IS 3020. He is extremely supportive of his students and is willing to accept work again if you submit it incorrectly. He teaches through a Github repository and Jupyter notebook. Both are really simple programs to use and the notebook gives you all the steps you need. Get used to Microsoft Teams

I believe I was one of the very first students who took the IS capstone with Professor Dominic Thomas. We learned the content system management tool called Drupal with the textbook that he wrote. As a project, we developed the SGCI online collection platform for the College of Arts and Zuckerman museum. Professor Thomas was always there to help us!

He want's you to learn code and you can work ahead of the class if you want to. I isn't hard, modules give you step by step and if you have an issue you can meet with him and he will help you understand. A great teacher.

Dr T is passionate about his classes and wants everyone to learn. He enjoys the work and engages with the students. You have to do the work to get the grade, but if you encounter issues he is there to help. He's a geek for sure and doesn't care, has a sense of humor and makes the classes fun. Very encouraging.

The semester didn't go as planned since everything was switched to being online due to COVID-19. However, Dominic Thomas is an amazing professor. He was always available to answer questions and he wants you to learn and understand the criteria. He always asked everybody about any questions or issues we have.

I took Prof Thomas for App Dev 1, he is very nice and is passionate about the material he teaches. Grades consist mainly of weekly Python modules/quizzes, demo projects, exercises here and there, and the semester project which are all easy if you ask questions when you need to and go to class. He factors in event participation into attendance, too.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Thomas exceeded my expectations for the class. This is a class that gives you a base knowledge of Python and teaches you how to think creatively. Professor Thomas knows his stuff.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Awesome professor!!!There is a bit of python coding that has to be done, just keep up with it and you will be fine, try and get ahead when you can. He will go out of his way to help you and is an amazing teacher. Dr. Thomas makes learning fun and lectures fly by.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: **I TOOK THIS IN THE SUMMER** I enjoyed this class! It's essentially a Python 101. If you're taking this in the summer, make it your only class. He's a nice and generous grader. He just wants you to do your best. You need our own computer. He grades for participation. Ask questions. He loves to help. I would recommend him!!

Dr. Thomas is the best professor has hired so far. He is always accessible whether it be by email, office hours, or even Groupme. He wants all of his students to learn and understand Python. The class was based off of two Microsoft Programming courses and a project. If you need help, he is always ready to assist! Plus, no textbook is required!

New professor at KSU. Class is somewhat running itself. Strict attendance policy get more than 5 absences & expect your grade to drop by 10%. Assignments were pulled from the sky. Not a clear understanding of what is expected for project. Likes to micromanage the class a lot. Gives busy work just to say he's doing something to show to higher ups.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring
